      • onFieldAccess

        public void onFieldAccess(java.lang.String className,
                          java.lang.String fieldName,
                          OnAccessWatchpoint handler)
        Shortcut for the common pattern of responding to field accesses.

        Builds a ClassPrepareRequest, filters it for the given class name, and adds an OnClassPrepare handler that creates an AccessWatchpointRequest for the given field name. Any field accesses are in turn handled by the given handler.

        TODO: what should this return?

        Parameters:
        className - A class name suitable for use by ClassPrepareRequest.addClassFilter(String)
        fieldName - A field name suitable for use by ReferenceType.fieldByName(String). Must be a field belonging to all classes matched by className.
        handler - The callback to execute when the field is accessed.

      • onFieldModification

        public void onFieldModification(java.lang.String className,
                                java.lang.String fieldName,
                                OnModificationWatchpoint handler)
        Shortcut for the common pattern of responding to field modifications.

        Builds a ClassPrepareRequest, filters it for the given class name, and adds an OnClassPrepare handler that creates a ModificationWatchpointRequest for the given field name. Any field modifications are in turn handled by the given handler.

        TODO: what should this return?

        Parameters:
        className - A class name suitable for use by ClassPrepareRequest.addClassFilter(String)
        fieldName - A field name suitable for use by ReferenceType.fieldByName(String). Must be a field belonging to all classes matched by className.
        handler - The callback to execute when the field is modified.

      • onMethodInvocation

        public void onMethodInvocation(java.lang.String className,
                               java.lang.String methodName,
                               OnBreakpoint handler)
        Shortcut for the common pattern of responding to particular method invocations.

        You would hope this could be handled with a simple MethodEntryRequest, but unfortunately, it can't. MethodEntryRequests can be filtered by class, instance, and thread, but not down to individual methods.

        This builds a ClassPrepareRequest, filters it for the given class name, and adds an OnClassPrepare handler that creates a BreakpointRequest for the given method name. The resulting BreakpointEvent is in turn handled by the given handler. Note that if you refer to an overloaded method, all matching methods will have a breakpoint set and be handled by the given handler. For greater control, use onMethodInvocation(String, String, String, OnBreakpoint)

        TODO: what should this return? A future for the BreakpointRequest?

        Parameters:
        className - A class name suitable for use by ClassPrepareRequest.addClassFilter(String)
        methodName - A method name suitable for use by ReferenceType.methodsByName(String). Must be a method belonging to all classes matched by className.
        handler - The callback to execute when the method is invoked.

      • onMethodInvocation

        public void onMethodInvocation(java.lang.String className,
                               java.lang.String methodName,
                               java.lang.String methodSig,
                               OnBreakpoint handler)
        Identical to onMethodInvocation(String, String, OnBreakpoint), extending filtering to include a method signature.

        TODO: what should this return? A future for the BreakpointRequest?

        Parameters:
        className - A class name suitable for use by ClassPrepareRequest.addClassFilter(String)
        methodName - A method name suitable for use by ReferenceType.methodsByName(String). Must be a method belonging to all classes matched by className.
        methodSig - A method signature suitable for use by ReferenceType.methodsByName(String, String). Must be a method belonging to all classes matched by className.
        handler - The callback to execute when the method is invoked.

      • once

        public <K extends DebugEventHandler> K once(K handler)
        Create a handler that runs the given handler once and then disables the event request that caused the handler to be invoked.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The type of the inner handler
        Parameters:
        handler - The inner handler
        Returns:
        An instance of Once cast to the same type as the inner handler.
